intro: Pilosella pericausta, commonly known as the rough hairypod, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green, hairy leaves. Pilosella pericausta typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
